tit.e: Takigi-noh (Noh play performed at night by a fire)
tit.cmt: 薪能→Takigi-noh (Noh theater performed at night by a fire)とデータベースに登録がありましたが→より適切な訳語→Takigi-noh (Noh play performed at night by a fire)に変更しました。

sen.j: 薪能（たきぎのう）は、主として夏場の夜間、能楽堂、もしくは野外に臨時に設置された能舞台の周囲にかがり火を焚いて、その中で特に選ばれた演目を演じる能。
sen.e: Takigi-noh (Noh play performed at night by a fire) is a Noh play that is especially chosen and performed in Noh Theater or on Noh stage with beacon fire around which is temporarily installed outside mainly on summer nights.

sen.j: 起源は平安時代中期にまで遡り、奈良の興福寺で催されたものが最初だという。
sen.e: The origin of Takigi-noh dates back to the middle of the Heian period, and the first Takigi-noh was performed in Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara Prefecture.

sen.e: Nowadays, Takigi-noh is performed on the eleventh and the twelfth in May in Kofuku-ji temple.

sen.j: ただし興福寺では薪御能（たきぎおのう）と呼ぶ。

sen.j: また、薪御能の源流はあくまで神事・仏事の神聖な儀式であり、野外で薪を燃やせば薪能になるのではないとしている。
sen.e: The headstream of Takigi-onoh is a sacred rite from Shinto rituals and Buddhist rituals; it may be regarded as Takigi-noh if Noh play is performed by a firewood outside.
